title: Adverb collection 2
sentences: I rarely eat pizza during the week.
vamos a ganar el partido de hoy.
We are surely going to win today's match.
venga a verte mañana por la tarde.
Perhaps I'll come to see you tomorrow afternoon.
necesites una chaqueta nueva para el frío.
Maybe you need a new jacket for the cold.
I hardly/barely have time to rest today.
mi perro sabe que es hora de comer.
Even my dog knows it's time to eat.
de estudiar, me gusta hacer deporte.
Besides studying, I like to do sports.
Can you put the books over there on the table?
Don't look back; follow your path.
The cat is on top of the kitchen cupboard.
de la puerta para que no se mueva.
Put the paper under the door so it doesn't move.
Open the window; outside it's a very beautiful day.
Come into the house; inside we are warmer.
Indeed, you were right about the price.
Fortunately, we didn't miss the train.
, no puedo ir a tu fiesta.
Unfortunately, I can't go to your party.
me gusta este helado de fresa.
I especially like this strawberry ice cream.
I generally get up at seven.
Can you speak louder? I can't hear you.
She speaks very softly/low and nobody understands her.
He/she didn't even greet me when he/she saw me.
Eat less sugar to be healthier.
un poco de agua, por favor.
I want a little more water, please.
no te gusta la comida de este lugar?
By any chance/Perhaps you don't like the food here?
dictionary:
Raramente - Rarely
Seguramente - Surely
Quizás - Perhaps
Tal vez - Maybe
Apenas - Barely/Hardly
Inclusive - Even
Además - Besides/Furthermore
Allá - Over there
Adelante - Forward
Atrás - Back/Behind
Encima - On top
Debajo - Underneath
Afuera - Outside
Adentro - Inside
Efectivamente - Indeed
Afortunadamente - Fortunately
Desgraciadamente - Unfortunately
Especialmente - Especially
Generalmente - Generally
Alto - Loudly
Bajo - Quietly/Low
Siquiera - Even (negation)
Menos - Less
Más - More
Acaso - Perhaps/Maybe
